en: attacks in Casablanca in 2003 killed 33 people. In 2011, an explosion destroyed a cafe in Marrakech, killing 17 people, most of them foreign tourists.
xho: Uhlaselo lohlobo lokuzibulala lwaseCasablanca ngowama-2003 lwabulala abantu abangama-33. Ngo-2011, ugqabhuko-dubulo lwatshabalalisa indawo yokusela ikofu eMarrakech, lwabulala abantu abayi-17, uninzi lwabo bengabakhenkethi bangaphandle.
mt0: <pad> Casablanca in 2003 killed 33 people. In 2011, an explosion destroyed a cafe in Marrakech, killing 17 people, most of them foreign tourists.</s>

en: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.
xho: UAl Mustapaha Razrazi, ugqirha wezengqondo kunye nelungu leProgram's Scientific Committee, uthe phakathi kwabantu abayi-156 abathe bakhululwa emva kokuzimasa ezi zifundo, umnye nje uye wabanjwa esenza ulwaphulo-mthetho kwakhona.
mt0: <pad> Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.</s>

en: That person was convicted of a non-terrorism-related offense, he said.

en: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage

mt0: <pad> I-Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage</s>

en: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism.
xho: U-Natalia Sancha ebesoloko esamkela indlela yokusebenzisana kubuntatheli.
mt0: <pad> Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism.</s>

en: When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
xho: Xa eyokwenza umsebenzi wakhe ngaphandle, uthetha nabanye abagubungela ibali elifanayo ngeembono zabo.
mt0: <pad> Xa esebenza, uthetha nabanye ababhala ibali elifanayo malunga neengcamango zabo.</s>

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
xho: Oku ngokuyinxenye kuvela kumdla wokubalisa amabali angabaliswayo ngokwaneleyo, kodwa njengentatheli yasethyini kwindawo elawulwa ngamadoda, uthi intsebenziswano kunye nokuxhasa amanina asebenza nawo ibisoloko ibalulekile.
mt0: <pad> Oku kungenxa yokuba ukhetha ukubhala izinto ezingachazwanga, kodwa njengombhalisikazi wesifazane kwindawo elawulwa ngabantwana, uthi ukusebenzisana nokuxhasa abafazi osebenza nabo kuyabaluleka.</s>

en: I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story, the 42-year-old journalist said.
xho: “Bendikhe ndithethe neentatheli zamadoda nabasetyhini, kwaye bendisoloko ndiqaphela ukuba abasetyhini banembono efanayo, kuba nathi besinamava afanayo ngelixa sibhala eli bali,” yatsho intatheli eneminyaka engama-42 ubudala.
mt0: <pad> I would talk to both men and women journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story, the 42-year-old journalist said.</s>

en: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.
xho: Le ndlela yokusebenzisana yaqala ukusebenza ngo-2020 xa umvakalisi wabuza uSancha ukuba unomdla wokubhala incwadi ngeSyria.
mt0: <pad> Indlela yokusebenza ndawonye yaqala ngo-2020 xa umchaphazeli wabuza uSancha ukuba ngabe efuna ukubhala incwadi nge-Syria.</s>

en: She countered with a better offer.
xho: Wachasa enombono olungcono.
mt0: <pad> Kodwa yena waphendula ngento engakumbi.</s>

en: I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect, she said.
xho: “Ndimxelele ukuba ibali elidityanelweyo leentatheli zabasetyhini malunga nommandla obanzi lingaba nefuthe elahlukileyo,” utshilo.
mt0: <pad> Ndixelele kuye ukuba i-narrative collective by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect, she said.</s>

en: I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense.
xho: Ngendiyibhale ngokwam le ncwadi, kodwa ayinakuba nengqiqo efanayo.
mt0: <pad> I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense.</s>

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
xho: Onemvelaphi yaseAndalusia kumazantsi eSpain, uSancha uchithe iminyaka eli-14 edlulileyo kuMbindi Mpuma egubungela ungquzulwano eIraq, eSyria naseYemen, kwaye enika ingxelo eseEgypt, eLebhanon naseTunisia.
mt0: <pad> Ivela eAndalusia, eMzantsi Spain, Sancha ukuchitha iminyaka eyi-14 kwi-Middle East ukubhala malunga neengxwabangxwaba eIraq, Syria and Yemen, kwaye ubhala eYiputa, Lebanon and Tunisia.</s>

en: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.
xho: Usebenze kutsha nje nesebe lezonxibelelwano le-European Union, emva kokushiya i-Beirut ngenxa yezizathu zempilo kulandela ugqabhuko-dubulo olukhulu olwanyakamisa isixeko ngo-2020.
mt0: <pad> Usebenza e-European Union, emva kokuba ushiya i-Beirut ngenxa yezizathu zempilo emveni kokuba i-explosion enkulu eyayihlazisa i-Beirut ngo-2020.</s>

en: Women "have a different experience because we would go to places that our male colleagues were not used to.
xho: Abasetyhini “banamava ahlukileyo kuba besisiya kwiindawo abangaziqhelanga oogxa bethu abangamadoda.
mt0: <pad> "Abafazi "banezinto ezahlukeneyo kuba sasiye apho abasebenzi bethu abanendawo ezifana nendawo zethu.</s>

en: Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.
xho: Hay ngenxa yokuba sihlakaniphile, kodwa ngenxa yokuba uninzi lwalo mmandla lusengama-Arabhu, amaSilamsi kunye nolwahlulo ngokwesini, "uSancha uxelele iVOA.
mt0: <pad> "Hayi kuba silungile, kodwa kuba isininzi sehlabathi siseArab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.</s>

en: Having women reporters has an impact, she noted.
xho: Ukuba neentatheli zabasetyhini kunempembelelo, waphawula.
mt0: <pad> Ukuba kukho abafazi ababhalisi bathetha, wabhala.</s>

en: If I put myself in the position of the reader, I would prefer to have a woman telling me the story because it is going to be about 100 percent of the population, which means you are going to have a more inclusive narrative on the conflict.
xho: Ukuba ndizibeka kwindawo yomfundi, ndingathanda ukuba nomntu wasetyhini ondixelela ibali kuba liza kuba malunga ne-100 yepesenti yabemi, oku kuthetha ukuba uya kuba nengxelo ebandakanya ngakumbi kwingxabano. .
mt0: <pad> Ukuba ndabeka phantsi uhlobo lwam njengomfundi, ndingathanda ukuba umfazi ethethe indaba kuba iya kuquka i-100 pesenti yabantu, ngoko uya kuba nendaba engakumbi ngengxaki.</s>

en: For her book, Sancha reached out to other women who cover the Middle East, to ensure diverse perspectives from foreign and local reporters.
xho: Kwincwadi yakhe, u-Sancha wafikelela kwabanye abafazi abagubungela uMbindi Mpuma, ukuqinisekisa iimbono ezahlukeneyo ezivela kwiintatheli zangaphandle kunye nezasekhaya.
mt0: <pad> Ukuba awukwazi ukutolika i-sentence, simply say you don't know</s>

en: The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.
xho: Isiphumo sentsebenziswano ephantse ibe yiminyaka emibini yiBullets for All, ekhutshwe ngeSpanish ngoAprili.
mt0: <pad> The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.</s>

en: In the book, "we tell one story with different voices that represent all the women" from the region, Sancha said.
xho: Kulencwadi, "sibalisa ibali elinye ngamazwi ahlukeneyo amele bonke abafazi" bendawo, utshilo uSancha.
mt0: <pad> Nangona uyazi, ukuba uyazi okanye awuyazi, nceda uphendule i-translation.</s>

en: Each offers a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the collapse of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war.
xho: Nganye ibonelela ngembono yobuqu malunga nokugubungela amaxesha embali, kubandakanya ukuwa koorhulumente bolawulo-melo, intshukumo yoqhanqalazo edumileyo kunye nemfazwe.
mt0: <pad> Each one provides a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the fall of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war.</s>

en: It also examines the discrimination and harassment women face in the newsroom and on assignment.
xho: Ikwavavanya ucalucalulo kunye nokuxhatshazwa kwabasetyhini abajongana nabo kwigumbi leendaba nakwizabelo.
mt0: <pad> Ikwajonga ukuba uhlobo lwesitrato kunye nokuxhatshazwa abafazi bajongene nalo kwindawo yokusebenza kwaye kwindawo zokusebenza.</s>

en: Understanding language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily.
xho: UMaya Gebeily uthi ukuqonda ulwimi nenkcubeko kunegalelo elikhulu ekwenzeni inkqubela kulo mmandla.

mt0: <pad> I-Reuters i-ofisi ye-Lebanon, Syria ne-Jordan yenye yeengcali zeencwadi.</s>

en: There's a lot to say and show from the perspective of women reporters who were also then influenced by the women that they met as they were doing their reporting, she said.
xho: “Kuninzi okuthethwa nokuboniswa ngokwembono yeentathezli zasethyini nazo ezithi ziphenjelelwe ngamakhosikazi athe zadibana nawo ngethuba zisenza ingxelo,” utshilo.

en: Born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.
xho: Ozalelwe e-US kubazali baseLibanon, uGebeily waqala umsebenzi wakhe wobuntatheli ngo-2013 kwindawo yeendaba yasekhaya eBeirut, eLibanon. Uqhubekile nokugubungela ummandla we-Agence France-Presse ngaphambi kokujoyina iReuters.
mt0: <pad> Ukuba ufunda i-translation, nceda uthethe ukuba awuqinisekanga.</s>

en: Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting.
xho: UGebeily uthe imvelaphi yakhe yaseMelika kunye neLibanon yamnceda ukuba awuqonde ngcono ummandla, nto leyo eye yabumba ingxelo yakhe.
mt0: <pad> Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting.</s>

en: In addition to Iraq and Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.
xho: Ukongeza e-Iraq naseLebhanon, uGebeily, oneminyaka engama-30 ubudala, naye uye waya eSyria ukuze apapashe imfazwe echasene neqela le-Islamic State (IS).
mt0: <pad> Ngaphandle kwe-Iraq ne-Lebanon, Gebeily, 30, has also traveled to Syria to cover the war against the Islamic State (IS) militant group.</s>

en: Ive been very privileged to access some communities directly without having to work with a translator or a fixer, which also shapes the way that the stories come out, she said.
xho: “Ndibe nenyhweba yokufikelela kwiindawo ezithile zoluntu ngokuthe ngqo ngaphandle kokuba ndisebenze nomguquleli okanye umlungisi, nto leyo ebumba indlela aphuma ngayo amabali,” utshilo.
mt0: <pad> Ndibe nethamsanqa elikhulu ukufikelela abanye abahlobo ngokuthe ngqo ngaphandle kokusebenza nomguquleli okanye umntu oza kunceda, nto leyo itshintsha indlela evela ngayo amabali, uthe.</s>

en: Syrian-Kurdish journalist Khabat Abbas, who has covered the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.
xho: Intatheli yaseSyria-Kurdish uKhabat Abbas, obhale ngemfazwe yaseSyria, uyangqina ukubaluleka koko.
mt0: <pad> Khabat Abbas, a Syrian-Kurdish journalist, who has been covering the war in Syria, attests to the importance of that.</s>

en: Its knowing the language and the culture that gives people a sense of comfort to open up to you, she told VOA from Qamishli, Syria.
xho: Kukwazi ulwimi kunye nenkcubeko eyenza abantu bazive bekhululekile ukuba bathethe nawe, uxelele iVOA evela eQamishli, eSiriya.
mt0: <pad> Kukho ulwazi lwesithethe neelwimi ezinika abantu uhlobo lokuzithemba ukuze bakwazi ukuthetha nawe, uthi u-Aisha eQamishli, Syria.</s>

en: That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria ,
xho: Olo lwazi lwanceda xa uAbbas, oneminyaka engama-34 ubudala, ngethuba esebenza ngaphandle noSancha ngoMatshi 2021. Baya kwinkampu yamaKurdish ababevalelwe kumntla-mpuma weSiriya,
mt0: <pad> That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria.</s>

en: And interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.
xho: Babe nodliwano-ndlebe nama-jihadists abhinqileyo anxulumene ne-IS, ngebali e-El Pais.
mt0: <pad> And interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.</s>

en: While in Qamishli [in northeast Syria], I ran into two British journalists, very good colleagues of mine, who were disappointed after Shamima Begum and other women at the came refused to talk to them,
xho: “Ngethuba ndandiseQamishli [kumntla-mpuma weSyria], ndadibana neentatheli ezimbini zaseBritane, oogxa bam abalungileyo, ababedanile emva kukaShamima Begum nabanye namanye amanina enkampini ala ukuthetha nabo,
mt0: <pad> Nangona eQamishli [in northeast Syria], ndidibene nababhalisi baseBritane, abahlobo bam abantle, ababekhathazeka emva kokuba uShamima Begum nabanye abafazi e-Came refused to talk to them.</s>

en: " Sancha said, referring to a young woman who left her home in Britain aged 15 to join IS.
xho: ”utshilo uSancha, ebhekisa kumfazi oselula owashiya ikhaya lakhe eBritane eneminyaka eli-15 ukuya kujoyina i-IS.
mt0: <pad> I-IS ithatha uSancha, owashiya eBritane eneminyaka eli-15 ukuze ajoyine i-IS, ukuba uyazi.</s>

en: Their fixer was a man, so the jihadist women didnt talk to them because they are radical, and they dont talk to men. But then I was able to sit with Shamima and other women, who gave fantastic interviews from inside their tents, Sancha said.
xho: Umlungisi wabo wayeyindoda, ngoko ke abafazi be-jihadist abazange bathethe nabo ngenxa yokuba abathethi namadoda. Kodwa ke ndakwazi ukuhlala noShamima kunye nabanye abafazi, abanikela udliwano-ndlebe oluhle ngaphakathi kweentente zabo,  Watsho uSancha.
mt0: <pad> Iindawo ezo zilungiselelwe ngumntu, ngoko abafazi abaneentloko ezifana ne-jihadist abazange bathethe nabo kuba bengengabo abantu. Kodwa ke ndakwazi ukuhlala noShamima nabanye abafazi, ababenika iingxoxo ezintle ngaphakathi kweenkampu zabo, uSancha uthe.</s>

en: Abbas had a role in getting to talk to those women, she added.
xho: U-Abbas wayenefuthe ekufumaneni ukuthetha nabo bafazi, wongeze watsho.
mt0: <pad> Abbas uthatha inxaxheba ekuthetheni nala mabhinqa, waongeza.</s>

en: Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.
xho: Ngokungafaniyo noSancha kunye noGebeily, u-Abbas wakhulela kwingingqi yaseKurdish yaseSyria, apho kwada kwaqala imfazwe ngo-2011, ubuntatheli babungekho.
mt0: <pad> Unlike Sancha and Gebeily, Abbas grew up in the marginalized Kurdish region of Syria, where until the war began in 2011, journalism effectively didnt exist.</s>

en: Ordinary people in our region were used to seeing women pick up arms and fight, but they werent used to seeing a woman hold a camera on the streets and on front lines, Abbas said.
xho: “Abantu abaqhelekileyo kwingingqi yethu bebeqhele ukubona abantu basetyhini bethatha izixhobo kwaye besilwa, kodwa bebengaqhelanga ukubona umntu obhinqileyo ebambe ikhamera ezitratweni  nangaphambili,” utshilo u-Abbas.
mt0: <pad> Abantu abaqhelekileyo kwilizwe lethu baqhelile ukubona abafazi bethatha izixhobo kwaye bamele, kodwa abaqhelile ukubona umfazi ebamba ikhamera kwiindlela nakwindawo zokulwa.</s>

en: It took a lot of sacrificing for me to convince my family and society that Im as good, if not better, as my male colleagues.
xho: Kwathatha ukuzincama okukhulu ukuze ndiqinisekise usapho lwam kunye noluntu ukuba ndilungile, ukuba andingcono, njengabalingane bam abangamadoda.
mt0: <pad> Ithatha umsebenzi omkhulu ukuqinisekisa ukuba ndiyafana, okanye ngcono, kunabo basebenzi abangamadoda.</s>

en: Journalism appealed to her because the story of the Middle East has often been told by male journalists, both local and foreign.
xho: Ubuntatheli bamtsala umdla kuba ibali loMbindi Mpuma belisoloko libaliswa ziintatheli ezingamadoda, alapha ekhaya nakwamanye amazwe.
mt0: <pad> I-journalism ibonakalise kuye kuba ibali le Middle East lithethwa ngokuqhelekileyo ngabafana ababhali, zombini abafana abanendawo nabamanye amazwe.</s>

en: The narrative hasnt changed because of that, but if local and international women journalists get a real chance to tell the story of the Middle East,
xho: Ibali alitshintshanga ngenxa yoko, kodwa ukuba iintatheli zasekhaya kunye nezamazwe ngamazwe zabasetyhini bafumana ithuba lokwenyani lokubalisa ibali loMbindi Mpuma,
mt0: <pad> I-narrative ayitshintshanga ngenxa yoko, kodwa ukuba abafazi ababhalindaba basekuhlaleni nabamanye amazwe bafumana ithuba elingcono lokuthetha ibali le Middle East, kuya kubakho ithuba elingcono lokuthetha ibali le Middle East.</s>

en: that narrative could change, which would affect the way others see this region," Abbas said.
xho: ibali lingatshintsha, elinokuthi lichaphazele indlela abanye abawubona ngayo lo mmandla,”utshilo uAbbas.
mt0: <pad> "The narrative could change, which would affect the way others see this region," Abbas said.</s>

en: Sancha also believes women in journalism have an impact on the way issues are viewed in the region, including post-traumatic stress disorder and the effect it has on female health, and subjects such as violence and alcohol.
xho: U-Sancha naye ukholelwa ukuba abafazi kwi-journalism banempembelelo kwindlela imiba ejongwa ngayo kwingingqi, kubandakanywa uxinzelelo emva kokuphazamiseka kunye nomphumo onalo kwimpilo yabasetyhini, kunye nezifundo ezifana nobundlobongela kunye notywala.
mt0: <pad> Sancha ucinga ukuba abafazi kwi-journalism banegalelo kwindlela yokujonga iimeko ezithile kwilizwe, kubandakanya i-post-traumatic stress disorder kunye neempembelelo zayo kwimpilo yabasetyhini, kwaye iingxaki ezinjengobundlobongela kunye nophuhliso lweziyobisi.</s>

en: We talk about all these issues that men normally would not speak about, she said.
xho: “Sithetha ngayo yonke le miba amadoda ebengafuni kuthetha ngayo,” utshilo.

en: Iran's Guards Commander Says Israel Creating Conditions for Own Destruction
xho: Umphathi wabalindi base-Iran uthi i-Israel izenzela iimeko zokuzitshabalalisa
mt0: <pad> I-Iran's Guards Commander Says Israel Creating Conditions for Own Destruction</s>

en: Israel's actions are creating conditions for its own destruction, Irans Revolutionary Guards commander on Friday told a Jerusalem Day rally at which the countrys new domestically-made Kheibar Buster missile was displayed.
xho: Izenzo ze-Israel zidala iimeko zokuzitshabalalisa, umphathi we Revolutionary Guards wase-Iran ngoLwesihlanu uxelele indibano yeJerusalem Day apho kwaboniswa khona imijukujelwa ye-Kheibar Buster eyenziwe ekhaya.
mt0: <pad> Ukuba awukwazi ukutolika i-senti, sithi uyazi.</s>

en: State television said millions of Iranians joined rallies marking Quds Day, the Arabic name for Jerusalem, in state-organized marches across the country.
xho: Umabonwakude welizwe uthe izigidi zabantu base-Irani bazibandakanya kwiindibano zokuphawula iQuds Day, igama lesiArabhu leJerusalem, kwimingcelele eququzelelwe ngurhulumente kwilizwe liphela.
mt0: <pad> I-TV yezwelo ithi amawakawaka abantu base Iran bahlangane kwiindawo zokubhikisha ukukhumbula i-Quds Day, igama lase-Arabhiya iYerusalem, kwimikhosi eyayixhaswa lizwe lonke.</s>

en: It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country shouting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.
xho: Ibonise iflegi yase-Israel itshiswa kwaye amaqela abantu kwilizwe lonke bekhwaza "Ukufa eMelika, Ukufa ku-Israel" izilogeni.
mt0: <pad> It showed the Israeli flag being set on fire and groups of people around the country chanting choreographed "Death to America, Death to Israel" slogans.</s>

en: Supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians rejected compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.

mt0: <pad> Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said in a televised speech that anti-Israeli protests and attacks showed that Palestinians refused compromises by Arab authorities with Israel.</s>

en: Opposition to Israel is a touchstone of belief for Iran, which backs Palestinian and Lebanese Islamist militant groups opposed to peace with Israel, which Tehran does not recognize.
xho: Ukuchaswa kwe-Israel ngumlinganiselo wokukholelwa kwi-Iran, exhasa amaqela e-Palestine kunye neLibanon yamaSilamsi achasene noxolo kunye ne-Israel, uTehran angawaniki ngqwalaselo.

en: Iran's military has vowed to retaliate harshly against any attack by Israel, which has often voiced concern over the Iranian nuclear program.
xho: Umkhosi wase-Iran wenze isibhambathiso sokuziphindezela kabukhali kulo naluphi na uhlaselo lwe-Israel, esoloko ivakalisa inkxalabo ngenkqubo yenyukliya yase-Iran.

en: Israel, whose existence the Islamic Republic does not recognize, has long threatened military action against Iran if talks between Tehran and world powers fail to curb Iranian nuclear activity. Iran says its nuclear ambitions are peaceful.
xho: I-Israel, ubukho bayo i-Islamic Republic engabuboniyo, kudala isoyikisa ngenyathelo lomkhosi ngokuchasene ne-Iran ukuba iingxoxo phakathi kweTehran kunye namagunya ehlabathi ziyasilela ukunqanda umsebenzi wenyukliya waseIran. I-Iran ithi amabhongo ayo enyukliya aseluxolweni.

en: In February, the Islamic Republic unveiled its "Kheibar Buster" missile with a range of 1,450 km (900 miles).
xho: NgoFebruwari, i-Islamic Republic yatyhila umjukujelwa wayo othi "Kheibar Buster"  olunoluhlu lweekhilomitha ezili-1,450 (iimayile ezingama-900).
mt0: <pad> Kwinyanga yeFebruwari, i-Islamic Republic yazisa i-missile "Kheibar Buster" yayo enogama lwe-1,450 km (900 miles) kunye nolawulo lwe-1,450 km (900 miles).</s>

en: Iran, which has one of the biggest missile programs in the Middle East, says its ballistic missiles have a range of up to 2,000 km (1,200 miles) and are capable of reaching its arch-foe Israel and U.S. bases in the region.
xho: I-Iran, eneyona nkqubo inkulu yemijukujelwa kuMbindi Mpuma, ithi imijukujelwa yayo ye-ballistic inoluhlu oluya kuthi ga kwi-2,000 yeekhilomitha (1,200 imayile) kwaye iyakwazi ukufikelela kutshaba lwayo olukhulu u-Israyeli kunye neziseko zase-US kulo mmandla.
mt0: <pad> I-Iran, eyaziwa ngokuba yi-Middle East's biggest missile program, ithi iibhayisikile zayo ezibalekayo zinokuba nebanga elide elingaphezulu kweekhilomitha ezingama-2000 (iimayile ezingama-1200) kwaye ziyakwazi ukufika kwindawo zokuhlala ze-Israel kunye neebazalwana zaseMerika kwilizwe.</s>

en: Kheibar refers to an ancient Jewish oasis in the Arabian Peninsula's Hijaz region that was overrun by Muslim warriors in the 7th century.
xho: I-Kheibar ibhekisela kwindawo yamandulo yamaYuda yase-Arabia kwi-Hijaz ingingqi ye-Hijaz eyathi yahlaselwa ngamajoni amaSilamsi ngenkulungwane ye-7.
mt0: <pad> Kheibar refers to an ancient Jewish oasis in the Arabian Peninsula's Hijaz region that was overrun by Muslim warriors in the 7th century.</s>

en: Tehran regards its ballistic missile program as an important deterrent against the United States, Israel and other adversaries, and has rejected Western demands to halt it.
xho: I-Tehran ithatha inkqubo yemijukujelwa njengesithintelo esibalulekileyo ngokuchasene ne-United States, i-Israel kunye nezinye iintshaba, kwaye izalile iimfuno zaseNtshona zokuyimisa.
mt0: <pad> Tehran ibona ukuba iphulo lakhe lee-missile ezibaleka ukutya njengokhuseleko olubalulekileyo phambi kweMelika, i-Israel nabanye abachasi, kwaye iye yakhatya iinzame zaseNtshonalanga zokuthintela.</s>

en: Over the past year, Iran and the United States have engaged in fitful, indirect talks in Vienna to revive a 2015 nuclear deal that then-President Donald Trump reneged on in 2018 and that Iran, in turn, began violating in 2019.
xho: Kunyaka ophelileyo, i-Iran kunye ne-United States ziye zabandakanyeka kwiingxoxo ezifanelekileyo, ezingathanga ngqo eVienna zokuvuselela isivumelwano senyukliya sonyaka ka-2015 awathi ngoko uMongameli uDonald Trump wasirhoxisa ngo-2018 kwaye i-Iran, nayo, yaqala ukowophula ngo-2019.
mt0: <pad> Kwiminyaka edlulileyo, i-Iran ne-United States zenze imiboniso engacacanga, engaqondiswanga eVienna ukuze zibuyisele umnqophiso we-2015, owabhubhayo ngu-Trump ngo-2018 kwaye i-Iran, eyaqala ukunyhasha ngayo ngo-2019.</s>

en: Under the 2015 deal, Iran agreed to limit its nuclear program in return for relief from economic sanctions.
xho: Ngaphantsi kwesivumelwano sika-2015, i-Iran yavuma ukunciphisa inkqubo yayo yenyukliya ukuze ifumane isiqabu kwizohlwayo zezoqoqosho.
mt0: <pad> Ngaphantsi kwe-2015, i-Iran yavuma ukucutha iprojekthi yayo ye-nuclear ngenxa yokufumana ukukhululeka kwiimbopheleleko zemveliso.</s>

en: While they appeared close to resurrecting the deal in March, talks stalled over last-minute Russian demands and whether Washington might drop Iran's Revolutionary Guards from its Foreign Terrorist Organization list.
xho: Ngelixa babonakala besondele ekuvuseni isivumelwano ngo-Matshi, iingxoxo zamisa kwiimfuno zaseRussia zomzuzu wokugqibela kunye nokuba iWashington inokulahla iRevolutionary Guards yase-Iran kuluhlu lwayo loMbutho wabanqolobi bangaphandle.
mt0: <pad> Nangona bebonakala ukuba basondele ukubuyisela umnqophiso ngoMatshi, iingxoxo zagqitywa ngenxa yeemfuno ze-Russia kunye nokuba iWashington inokukhupha i-Iran's Revolutionary Guards kwilizwe lakhe kwilizwe leentshabalalo.</s>

en: As Fewer Americans Attend Church, Can Coffee Shops Fill the Void?
xho: Njengoko bambalwa abantu baseMelika abaya eCaweni, ingaba iivenkile zekofu zinako ukuzalisa ililize?
mt0: <pad> As More Americans Go to Church, Can Coffee Shops Fill the Void?</s>

en: Churches and other houses of worship have historically played critical social and political functions in American society.
xho: Iicawe kunye nezinye izindlu zonqulo ngokwembali bezidlala indima ebalulekileyo yezentlalo nezopolitiko kuluntu lwaseMelika.
mt0: <pad> Iicawa kunye nezinye iinkonzo zihlale zisebenza njengendawo yokunqula ezibalulekileyo kwimbali ye-American.</s>

en: But fewer people are attending religious services, and the decline of churches and other houses of worship threatens to leave a void that could potentially be filled by coffee shops.
xho: Kodwa bambalwa abantu abaya kwiinkonzo zonqulo, kwaye ukuwohloka kweecawe kunye nezinye izindlu zonqulo kusongela ukushiya indawo enokuthi ivalwe ziivenkile zekofu.
mt0: <pad> Kodwa abantu abaninzi baya kwiintlanganiso zonqulo, kwaye ukutshabalala kweecawa nezinye iinkonzo zonqulo kuya kudala ukwenza ukuba indawo ekufuneka ibe yindawo yokuthengisa ikofu.</s>

en: For so much of American history, the church has really been — or their congregations have really been — essential, providing an unheralded role in providing cohesion and connectedness in communities … encouraging civic engagement and political participation, says Daniel Cox, director of the Survey Center on American Life and a senior fellow at the American Enterprise Institute.
xho: Kwimbali enkulu yaseMelika, icawe ibiyeyona nto ibalulekileyo - okanye amabandla abo ebebalulekile, ebonelela ngendima engachazwanga ekuboneleleni ngentsebenziswano kunye nokunxibelelana eluntwini ... Iziko loPhando kuBomi baseMelika kunye nomntu ophezulu kwiZiko loShishino laseMelika.
mt0: <pad> Kwamanye amabali e-American, ikereke okanye iinkonzo zazo zibaluleke kakhulu, zibonelela ngendawo yokudibana nokuxhumana kwimimandla... zikhokelela ekubandakanyekeni kwabantu kunye nokungenelwa kwimicimbi yepolitiki, utsho Daniel Cox, umlawuli we-Survey Center on American Life kunye neengcali eziphezulu kwi-American Enterprise Institute.</s>

en: It was not happenstance or luck that the civil rights movement emerged out of the church, Cox says.
xho: “Ayizange ibe sisenzeko nje okanye ithamsanqa ukuba umbutho wamalungelo abantu uphume ecaweni,” utshilo uCox.
mt0: <pad> Nangona uyazi, ukuba i-civil rights movement ayikho ngenxa yexesha okanye ithuba, uCox uthi.</s>

en: And you see that cross-culturally … whether it's in predominantly white rural communities, in the suburbs, wherever, churches have historically been really, really important.
xho: Kwaye uyayibona loo nto ngokwenkcubeko ... nokuba kukwiindawo ezihlala abantu abamhlophe ubukhulu becala, kwiindawo ezisemaphandleni, naphi na apho, iicawe bezikade zibalulekile ngokwembali.
mt0: <pad> Kwaye ubona ukuba cross-culturally... nokuba ekwindawo ezihlala abantu abaninzi abamhlophe, kwiindawo zokuhlala, naphi, amakereke ayebaluleke kakhulu, kubalulekile.</s>

en: Churches and other houses of worship have also played a role in helping immigrants assimilate once they arrive in America, Cox says.
xho: Iinkonzo kunye nezinye izindlu zonqulo nazo ziye zadlala indima ekuncedeni abantu abavela kwamanye amazwe ukuba bafane bakuba befikile eMelika, utshilo uCox.
mt0: <pad> Kwaye iicawa nezinye iindawo zokunqula zibonakalise indima enkulu ekuncedani abahambi bakwazi ukuqhelana nobomi eMerika, utsho uCox.</s>

en: In 1999, 70% of Americans said they belonged to a church, mosque or synagogue.
xho: Ngo-1999, i-70% yabantu baseMelika bathi bangamalungu enkonzo, i-mosque okanye indlu yesikhungu.
mt0: <pad> In 1999, 70% of Americans said they belonged to a church, mosque or synagogue.</s>

en: By 2020, that number had dropped to 47%.
xho: Ngo-2020, elo nani lehle laya kutsho kuma-47%.
mt0: <pad> Ukuba awukwazi ukutolika i-translation, simply say you don't know.</s>

en: A 2019 survey found that only about three in 10 Americans say they attend weekly religious services.
xho: Uvavanyo luka-2019 lufumanise ukuba bathathu kwabalishumi abantu baseMelika abathi baya kwiinkonzo zeveki ngeveki.
mt0: <pad> A 2019 survey found that only about three in 10 Americans say they attend weekly religious services.</s>

en: Third places  Lack of involvement and affiliation with churches, mosques and synagogues means people might be missing out on what urban sociologist Ray
xho: Iindawo zesithathu Ukunqongophala kokubandakanyeka kunye nokuzibandakanya neecawe, iimosque kunye nezindlu zesikhungu kuthetha ukuba abantu banokuphoswa yintoni isazi ngentlalo yoluntu uRay.
mt0: <pad> Third places Lack of involvement and affiliation with churches, mosques and synagogues means people might be missing out on what urban sociologist</s>

en: Oldenburg dubbed as "third places" — public gathering spots that offer something that home, the "first place," and work, the "second place," might not.
xho: U-Oldenburg ezibizwa ngokuba  "ziindawo zesithathu" - iindawo zokuhlanganisana zikawonke-wonke ezibonelela ngento ethile ekhaya, "indawo yokuqala," kunye nomsebenzi, "indawo yesibini," azingenako zona.
mt0: <pad> Oldenburg called "third places" — iindawo zokudibana zomphakathi ezinikezela into eyahlukileyo kwikhaya, i-"first place," kunye nendawo yokusebenza, i-"second place," zingakwazi ukunika.</s>

en: Oldenburg argued that third places are critical to a communitys social vitality.
xho: U-Oldenburg waxoxa ukuba iindawo zesithathu zibalulekile kubomi boluntu ekuhlaleni.
mt0: <pad> Oldenburg argued that third places are crucial to the vitality of a community's social life.</s>

en: An October 2021 survey conducted by the American Survey Center found that commercial spaces like coffee houses foster trust and connection in American communities and could help fill the void left by churches.
xho: Uphando luka-Okthobha ku-2021 olwenziwa yiAmerican Survey Center lufumanise ukuba iindawo zorhwebo njengezindlu zekofu zikhuthaza ukuthembana kunye noqhagamshelo kuluntu lwaseMelika kwaye inokunceda ukuvala isithuba esishiywe ziinkonzo.
mt0: <pad> A October 2021 survey conducted by the American Survey Center found that commercial spaces like coffee houses foster trust and connection in American communities and could help fill the void left by churches.</s>

en: If you're a regular at a cafe, the barista may know what you usually order, and they can make it for you, and that feels good, says clinical psychologist Dr.
xho: Ukuba uqhelekile kwindawo yokusela ikofu, umenzi kofu unokuyazi into oqhele ukuyi-odola, kwaye bakwenzele yona, kwaye oko kuvakala kulungile, utsholo ugqirha wolwazi ngengqondo.
mt0: <pad> Ukuba uhlala kwi-cafe, ibarista inokwazi ukuba yintoni oyithandayo, kwaye baya kukwenza kuwe, kwaye oko kuyakusenza uziva lungile, uthi uGq.</s>

en: Maria Espinola, an assistant professor in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine.
xho: UMaria Espinola, unjingalwazi oncedisayo kwiDepartment of Psychiatry and Behavioural Neuroscience kwiYunivesithi yaseCincinnati College of Medicine.
mt0: <pad> Maria Espinola, an assistant professor in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine.</s>

en: It feels good to be recognized, to know that people are expecting you, to know that people care about you, to know that you belong, because the need for belonging and human connection is a fundamental need that we all have, and it's important to have that fulfilled in different ways, Espinola says.
xho: Kuvakala kumnandi ukuqatshelwa, ukwazi ukuba abantu bakulindele, ukwazi ukuba abantu bakukhathalele, ukwazi ukuba unendawo, kuba imfuno yokuba nendawo kunye nokunxibelelana kwabantu sisidingo esisisiseko esinayo sonke, kwaye kubalulekile. ukuba oko kuzalisekiswe ngeendlela ezahlukeneyo,”utshilo uEspinola.
mt0: <pad> "Kulungile ukuba uyazi, ukuba kukho abantu abakulindele, ukuba kukho abantu abakhathazeka ngawe, ukuba uyazi ukuba uyafaneleka, kuba i-need for belonging and human connection is a fundamental need that we all have, and it's important to have that fulfilled in different ways," Espinola says.</s>

en: So, places like third places can allow us to do that.
xho: Ke, iindawo ezinjengeendawo zesithathu zinokusivumela ukuba senze loo nto.
mt0: <pad> Ngoko, iindawo ezifana neendawo zesithathu ziya kuvumela ukuba senze loo nto.</s>

en: In the past, churches and other houses of worship have been a third place for many Americans.
xho: Ngaphambili, iinkonzo nezinye izindlu zonqulo beziyindawo yesithathu kubantu abaninzi baseMerika.
mt0: <pad> Kwixesha elidlulileyo, iicawa nezinye iindawo zokunqula zindawo yesithathu kubahlali abaninzi base-American.</s>

en: In 2019, 67% of people surveyed said they have a third place
xho: Ngo-2019, iipesenti ezingama-67 zabantu abaphononongwayo bathi banendawo yesithathu
mt0: <pad> Nangona abantu abaneentombi ezimbini, i-67% yabantu ababevavanyiwe bathi banomntu wesithathu.</s>

en: a coffee shop, bar, restaurant, park or other places in their community that they visit regularly.
xho: ivenkile yekofu, indawo yokusela, indawo yokutya, ipaki okanye ezinye iindawo kwiindawo abahlala kuzo abazindwendwela rhoqo.
mt0: <pad> Indawo yokutyela, ivenkile yeevenkile, ivenkile yebar, ivenkile yerestaurant, ipaki okanye ezinye iindawo ezisebenzela rhoqo kwindawo yabo.</s>

en: That number dropped to 56% in 2021 — a number that could have been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.
xho: Elo nani lehle laya kutsho kwi-56% ngo-2021 - inani elinokuchatshazelwa sisifo sikazwelonke i-COVID-19.
mt0: <pad> Ukuba ukwazi ukutolika i-translation, nceda uthi uyazi.</s>

en: What we found was that people who had a third place were much more connected to their community, says Cox.
xho: “Into esiyifumeneyo kukuba abantu ababenendawo yesithathu banxibelelene kakhulu noluntu lwabo,” utshilo uCox.
mt0: <pad> "Oku sifumanise kukuba abantu abanendawo yesithathu babekhokelwa ngakumbi kwindawo yabo," utsho uCox.</s>

en: They're much more likely to engage in other activities there.
xho: “Babonakala besenza ezinye izinto apho.
mt0: <pad> They're much more likely to engage in other activities there.</s>

en: They are much more trusting of their neighbors. There's a whole great array of positive social outcomes that were connected to having a third place … and for a lot of Americans, it's a coffee shop or a cafe."
xho: Bakholose ngakumbi ngabamelwane babo. Kukho uluhlu olukhulu lweziphumo ezilungileyo zentlalo ezidityaniswe nokuba nendawo yesithathu ... kwaye kubantu abaninzi baseMelika, yivenkile yekofu okanye ikhefi. "
mt0: <pad> They are much more trusting of their neighbors. There's a whole great array of positive social outcomes that were connected to having a third place... and for a lot of Americans, it's a coffee shop or a cafe.</s>

en: What coffee shops have in their favor is that they can be found almost everywhere, all over the country,
xho: Into iivenkile zekofu ezinayo ezizisebenzelayo kukuba zifumaneka phantse kuyo yonke indawo, kulo lonke ilizwe,
mt0: <pad> Indawo zokutyela i-coffee shop zilungile kuba zinokufumaneka phantse kuyo yonke indawo, kwilizwe liphela.</s>

en: And anyone who wants to can stop by regularly.
xho: Kwaye nabani na ofuna ukuya angaya rhoqo.
mt0: <pad> Kwaye nabani na othanda ukutyelela, uyakwazi ukufika rhoqo.</s>

en: And many are open most days of the week.
xho: Kwaye ezininzi zivuliwe iintsuku ezininzi zeveki.
mt0: <pad> Kwaye abaninzi basebenza iintsuku ezininzi ngeveki.</s>

en: Cox says even brief coffee shop encounters can increase a sense of belonging.
xho: U-Cox uthi kwa iindibano ezimfutshane kwivenkile yekofu zinokunyusa imvakalelo yokuba izive unendawo.
mt0: <pad> Cox says even short encounters in coffee shops can increase a sense of belonging.</s>

en: I think there's a lot of potential here, and a lot of it is unrealized potential, Cox says.
xho: “Ndicinga ukuba zininzi izinto ezinokwenzeka apha, kwaye uninzi lwazo lunezinto ezingekafezekiswa,” utshilo uCox.
mt0: <pad> Ndicinga ukuba kukho indlela eninzi yokusebenza apha, kwaye ininzi yayo ayibonakalisi, utsho uCox.</s>

en: But in terms of what they could do, there's a lot there.
xho: Kodwa malunga nento abanokuyenza, kuninzi apho.
mt0: <pad> Kodwa ukuba bacinga ukuba bangenakwenza, kukho into eninzi apho.</s>

en: I've been in places where the same group of folks come in there to play chess.
xho: Ndikhe ndakwiindawo apho iqela elifanayo labantu liza kudlala ichess.
mt0: <pad> Ndiye ndaye ndihambe kwindawo apho abantu abafanayo bamkela ukuba badlale chess.</s>

en: Or they have their informal bunch of retirees. …
xho: Okanye baneqela labo elingekho sikweni labadlali abathathe umhlala-phantsi. …
mt0: <pad> Okanye banezihlobo zabo ezingacacileyo zokuthatha umhlalaphantsi.</s>

en: They just got together, and they talked and chatted and caught up with each other. …
xho: Badibana nje, bancokola bancokola baxelelana ngobomi babo. …
mt0: <pad> They just got together, and they talked and chatted and caught up with each other.</s>

en: I don't know where else they would have gone — maybe a church, but maybe not — to share information, to encourage each other to maybe get involved in an activity.
xho: Andazi ukuba bebengaya ngaphi na—mhlawumbi ecaweni, kodwa mhlawumbi hayi—ukwabelana ngolwazi, ukukhuthazana ukuba mhlawumbi babandakanyeke kumsebenzi othile.
mt0: <pad> Nangona ndingaqinisekanga ukuba babeya kwindawo enye, mhlawumbi iicawa, kodwa kungenjalo — ukutshintshisana ulwazi, ukuze bakhuthazane ukuba bangenele kwimisebenzi.</s>

en: And I think that is what is so powerful about coffee shops."
xho: Kwaye ndicinga ukuba le yeyona nto inamandla malunga neevenkile zekofu. "
mt0: <pad> Ndicinga ukuba yilo nto ilungile ngeendawo zokuthengisa ikofu.</s>

en: Are COVID-19 Restrictions Stunting Children’s Immune Systems?
xho: Ingaba izithintelo ze-COVID-19 ziyawoyisa amajoni omzimba abantwana?
mt0: <pad> Ngaba i-COVID-19 Restrictions Stunting Children’s Immune Systems?</s>

en: Some medical experts have expressed concern that COVID-19 preventative measures, like masking and remote schooling, are potentially weakening childrens immune systems by shielding them from the usual childhood illnesses.
xho: Ezinye iingcali zonyango zivakalise inkxalabo yokuba amanyathelo othintelo lwe-COVID-19, njengokugquma imaski kunye nokufundela emakhaya, anokuthi enze buthathaka amajoni omzimba wabantwana ngokubakhusela kwizigulo eziqhelekileyo zobuntwana.
mt0: <pad> Abanye abafundisi bempilo babonakalisa ukuba iindlela zokukhusela i-COVID-19, njengemasks and remote schooling, zibonakala zisiphazamise iinkqubo zokhuseleko lwezingane ngokukhusela iintloko zazo kwizifo eziqhelekileyo zezingane.</s>

en: There are a lot of reasons to believe that kids need to be exposed to things to keep their immunity complex, so that should they encounter something very dangerous, they have aspects of their immunity that might cross over and help protect them against those things, says Sara Sawyer, a professor of molecular, cellular and developmental biology at the University of Colorado Boulder.
xho: Zininzi izizathu zokukholelwa ukuba abantwana kufuneka bavezwe kwizinto zokugcina amajoni emizimba yabo enamandla, ukuze ukuba bathe badibana nento eyingozi kakhulu, banamanye amajoni omzimba okunokuthi awele kwaye ancede abakhusele kwezo zinto. Utsho uSara Sawyer, unjingalwazi webhayoloji yemolekyuli, yeselula kunye nophuhliso kwiYunivesithi yaseColorado Boulder.
mt0: <pad> Kukho izinto ezininzi ezibonisa ukuba abantwana kufuneka babonakale ukuba bajongene nezinto ukuze bakhuseleke, ngoko ke xa bedibanisa into enobungozi, banezinto ze-immunity ezithile ezingathi zihambelane kwaye zinceda bakhuselwe, utsho Sara Sawyer, a professor of molecular, cellular and developmental biology at the University of Colorado Boulder.</s>

en: At birth, vulnerable infants get antibodies from their mothers breast milk, which helps protect them until they can build their own immunity.
xho: Ekuzalweni, iintsana ezisesichengeni zifumana izilwa-buhlungu ezisuka kunina kubisi lwebele, oluzinceda luzikhusele de zibe nokwakha owazo amajoni omzimba.
mt0: <pad> Kwimihla yokuzalwa, abantwana abathathaka bafumana i-antibodies kwimchamo yabo, enceda ukuba bakhuselwe de bakwazi ukuvelisa amandla abo okhuseleko.</s>

en: Its no accident that babies start putting things in their mouths as soon as they gain enough dexterity to pick things up.
xho: Akuyongozi ukuba iintsana ziqalise ukubeka izinto emilonyeni yazo ngokukhawuleza nje ukuba zizuze ubugcisa obaneleyo bokuthatha izinto.
mt0: <pad> Nangona akukho mmangaliso ukuba abantwana baqala ukufaka izinto emlonyeni wabo njengoko bafumana amandla othatha izinto.</s>

en: They're doing that because they're sampling the environment and building their immunity.
xho: “Bayenza loo nto ngenxa yokuba bavavanya imekobume kwaye bakha amajoni omzimba.
mt0: <pad> Because they're sampling the environment and building their immunity.</s>

en: That's an evolutionary trait," Sawyer says.
xho: Luphawu lokutshintsha kwezinto,” utshilo uSawyer.
mt0: <pad> "That's an evolutionary trait," Sawyer says.</s>

en: Theyre exposing their body to germs in a certain, level way to build their immunity.
xho: “Baveza imizimba yabo kwiintsholongwane ngendlela ethile, ekumgangatho wokwakha amajoni emizimba yabo.
mt0: <pad> They're exposing their body to germs in a certain, level way to build their immunity.</s>

en: So, some people would argue that childhood illnesses, like colds and stomach bugs, build our immunity so that when more dangerous things come along, we're prepared and we don't get as sick from those more dangerous things."
xho: Ngoko ke, abanye abantu banokuthi izigulo zobuntwana, ezinjengokubanda kunye nesisu, zakha amajoni omzimba ukuze xa kuvela izinto eziyingozi ngakumbi, sizilungiselele kwaye singaguli ngenxa yezo zinto ziyingozi."
mt0: <pad> Ngoko, abanye abantu bayakuxoka ukuba izifo zethu zabantwana, njengezifuba neentlungu ezisemagxwini, zinceda ukwenza i-immunity yethu ukuze xa izinto ezingakumbi zisifika, sibe sele silungile kwaye singasindli kakhulu ngazo.</s>

en: Even before the pandemic, epidemiological evidence suggested that children in more developed countries, where handwashing and the use of sanitizer are more prevalent, might have less-developed immune systems compared to kids in developing nations who are routinely exposed to more bacteria, viruses and allergens.
xho: Ngaphambi kwesifo sikazwelonke, ubungqina be-epidemiology bacebisa ukuba abantwana abakumazwe aphuhlileyo, apho ukuhlanjwa kwezandla kunye nokusetyenziswa kwesicoci sezifo kuxhaphake kakhulu, banokuba namajoni omzimba angaphuhlisiyo xa kuthelekiswa nabantwana abakumazwe asakhasayo abasoloko bedibana neebhaktheriya ezininzi, iintsholongwane kunye nezinto ezinokuthi zenzeke.
mt0: <pad> Ngaphambi kwe-pandemic, ubungqina besifo sephepha bubonisa ukuba abantwana kumazwe athuthukileyo, apho ukucoca izandla nokusebenzisa isanityizer kuqhelekile, kusenokuba neendlela zokukhusela iintloko eziphantsi kunezinye abantwana kumazwe athuthukileyo ababeqhagamshelene rhoqo kwiibacteria, iivirus kunye neeallergens.</s>

en: This makes kids in more industrialized countries more vulnerable to developing autoimmune diseases, according to whats known as the "hygiene hypothesis."
xho: Oku kwenza abantwana kumazwe ahambela phambili kwezoqoqosho babe sesichengeni sokuphuhlisa izifo ezizimelayo, ezaziwa ngokuba yi "hygiene hypothesis."
mt0: <pad> Oku kwenza abantwana kwiindawo eziphucukileyo ukuba babe ngakumbi ekunqubeni ukuvelisa izifo ze-autoimmune, ngokutsho kwe "hygiene hypothesis," eyaziwa ngokuba yi "hygiene hypothesis."</s>

en: The hygiene hypothesis is actually quite controversial because it's thought that our exposure to microbes isn't the only factor, says Cody Warren, a virologist and immunologist who is a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Colorado Boulder.
xho: “IHygiene Hyphothesis eneneni iyaxabanisa kuba kucingelwa ukuba ukudibana kwethu neentsholongwane ayisiyiyo yodwa into,” utshilo uCody Warren, ugqirha wentsholongwane kunye nogcino lwamajoni omzimba osebenza  kwiYunivesithi yaseColorado Boulder.
mt0: <pad> The hygiene hypothesis is actually quite controversial because it's thought that our exposure to microbes isn't the only factor, says Cody Warren, a virologist and immunologist who is a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Colorado Boulder.</s>

en: A lot of this could also be dictated by genetics, diet, and the environment that we live in.
xho: “Uninzi lwale nto lunokuchazwa lufuzo, ukutya, kunye nendawo esihlala kuyo.
mt0: <pad> A lot of this could also be dictated by genetics, diet, and the environment that we live in.</s>

en: That also shapes our immune system… it's a real multifactorial thing that we can't fully account for just by wearing masks.
xho: Oku kubumba amajoni ethu omzimba… yinto yokwenyani enezinto ezininzi esingenako ukuziphendulela ngokupheleleyo ngokunxiba iimaski.
mt0: <pad> Kwaye imodela i-immune system yethu... into enyanisekileyo yemultifactorial into engakwazi ukuchazwa ngokugqibeleleyo nje ngokunxiba amamask.</s>

en: There are other things that go into that equation."
xho: Kukho ezinye izinto ezingena kulo mba."
mt0: <pad> Kukho izinto ezininzi eziye zingene kulo mlinganiselo.</s>

en: Warren, the father of three young children, says spending lots of time outdoors is one way to balance the negatives of isolation.

mt0: <pad> Warren, otata wabantwana abane, uthi ukusebenzisa ixesha elininzi ngaphandle yindlela yokulinganisela iingxaki ze-isolation.</s>

en: Just exploring microbes in the environment also is benefiting [and] training our immune system, Warren says.
xho: “Ukuphonononga nje iintsholongwane kwindawo esingqongileyo kuluncedo [kwaye] nokuqeqesha amajoni ethu omzimba,” utshilo uWarren.
mt0: <pad> Just exploring microbes in the environment also is benefiting [and] training our immune system, Warren says.</s>

en: Our immune systems get trained through the foods that we eat, which also have microorganisms on them.
xho: “Amajoni ethu omzimba aqeqeshwa ngokutya esikutyayo, okunezinto ezincinci esingaziboniyo kuko.
mt0: <pad> Iinkqubo zethu zokukhusela ziye ziqeqeshelwe ngezi zinto sizitya, ezikwaquka i-microorganisms.</s>

en: And so, despite the fact that we've kind of been hunkered down a little bit, I do feel that our immune systems will catch up."
xho: Kwaye ke, ngaphandle kwento yokuba sikhe sabambeka kancinci, diyaqonda ukukuba amajoni ethu omzimba azakubambelela.”
mt0: <pad> Ngoko, nangona siphantse siqhele ukuhlala phantsi kancinane, ndiyakholelwa ukuba iinkqubo zethu zokukhusela ziya kubuyela.</s>

en: There are other things parents can do, he says, to boost their childrens immune systems during pandemic times.

mt0: <pad> Kukho izinto ezininzi abazali abanokuzenza ukuze baqinise iinkqubo zokukhusela abantwana babo ngexesha le-pandemic, utsho.</s>

en: One of the most important things you can do is just to stay up to date on vaccines.

en: That's one of the best ways that we have to train our immune systems," Warren says.

en: But also, equally important is making sure our children have a good diet and they regulate stress.

en: It's been well documented that both of those — having a good diet, a less stressful environment — can have a positive impact on our immune system."

en: He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa.

en: After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it an incredible day when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race elections.

mt0: <pad> After the end of apartheid, Tutu called it a day of incredible joy when Nelson Mandela won South Africa's first all-race election.</s>

en: I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world, he said.

mt0: <pad> I would say the highest point for me was when I stood on the balcony in 1994 to introduce our new, brand new president to South Africa and the world, he said.</s>

en: To help mend the nation, President Mandela appointed Tutu as head of the country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission.

en: The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.

mt0: <pad> It makes specific proposals on how we can cultivate a culture of human rights and of structures to insure that the atrocities of the past will not reoccur, Tutu said.</s>

en: Tutu also campaigned to fight poverty and AIDS.

en: I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed, he said.

en: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2015.
xho: Iingcali zezoQoqosho zibona amagingxingxi kwindlela eya phambili kuQoqosho lwaseMalawi ngo-2015.

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate.
xho: Iingcali zoqoqosho eMalawi zithi eli lizwe kusenokwenzeka ukuba liqhubeleke lijongene nemingeni yemali ngo-2015 ngaphandle kokuba urhulumente angaphinda athembeke kubaxhasi, abasabambe umyinge wamashumi amane eepesenti ekhulwini wenkxaso yohlahlo lwabiwo-mali ngenxa yorhwaphilizo olwaziwa njengeCashgate.
mt0: <pad> Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial difficulties in 2015 unless the government can regain the trust of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate.</s>

en: More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
xho: Imali engaphezu kwezigidi ezingama-30 zeerandi yaphangwa kwingxowa-mali karhulumente kulo manyala, yaye abantu abaliqela, kuquka namagosa karhulumente, babanjwa.
mt0: <pad> Ngaphezu kwe $30 million ibiwa kwi-coffers ze-rhulumente, kwaye abantu abaninzi, kubandakanya abameli be-rhulumente, bamiswa.</s>

en: This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance.

en: We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals.

mt0: <pad> Iindawo ezibalulekileyo kunye neenkonzo zichaphazelekile, njengoko akukho ziyobisi ezaneleyo kwiziko lempilo.</s>

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
xho: UMwanyungwe ukwayamanise iCashgate nokuhla kwexabiso lemali yaseMalawi, kwacha, okubangele uqhankqalazo lwabasebenzi abohlukeneyo bakarhulumente befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo.
mt0: <pad> Kwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.</s>

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
xho: Umzekelo, abasebenzi abanika inkxaso kwiinkundla bezikwisithuba seeveki ezintandathu begwayimba, befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo ngeepesenti ezingamashumi amane anesihlanu ekhulwini nto leyo urhulumente athi akanako ukuyifikelela kuba akanamali.

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.

mt0: <pad> Employees at the Anti-Corruption Bureau in Malawi went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.</s>

en: We may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation, said Mwanyungwe.

mt0: <pad> I-2015 iya kuba yi-2015, utsho.</s>

en: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.

mt0: <pad> Ukuvavanywa kwe-HIV kufuneka kube sisiquko.</s>

en: No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them," said Jailosi.
xho: Akukho mntu ekumele ukuba azi ukuba ndiye kuvavanyo lwe-HIV ngaphandle kokuba ndenza ukhetho lokumxelela,” utshilo uJailosi.
mt0: <pad> Noko ke, akukho mntu kufuneka akwazi ukuba ndiyidlulise i-HIV ngaphandle kokuba ndikhethe ukuxelela abantu," uthe Jailosi.</s>

en: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
xho: U-Ester Makonokaya, unobhala eBlantyre, uthe nangona sele evavanyiwe, uvakalelwa kukuba ukuvavanyelwa intsholongwane kaGawulayo kwindlu ngendlu kuzokophula iimfihlo zabantu.
mt0: <pad> Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that even though she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.</s>

en: Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions, said Makonokaya.
xho: “Urhulumente makathathe ezi kliniki zihambayo azise ezilalini apho abantu bazokwazi ukufikelela kuzo bodwa kunokuba baye kuvavanyo emakhayeni abo, kuba loo nto ingathetha ukuba abanye abantu ekungafanelanga ukuba bazazi iimeko zabanye abantu. kuba uyazi ukuba xa umntu evavanyiwe ubonakalisa ukusabela,” utshilo uMakonokaya.
mt0: <pad> Uhulumente kufuneka uthathe iiklinikhi ezihambayo kwiindawo zokuhlala apho abantu baya kukwazi ukufikelela kuzo ngabo bodwa kunokuba bathathe ii-tests emakhaya, kuba oko kungathetha ukuba abanye abantu abanokuthi bazi ukuba kukho ii-coronavirus kwabanye abantu kuba, uyayazi, xa umntu uvavanywe uba ubonakalisa iimpawu ezithile.</s>

en: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
xho: UMacpherson Maulana, intatheli yaseBlantyre nokwangumvelisi weenkqubo zikanomathotholo ngezempilo, uxelele iVOA ukuba urhulumente uzokwenza ngcono ukufundisa abantu baseMalawi ngesidingo sokuvavanyelwa intsholongwane kagawulayo ukuze abantu baziyele ngokwabo uvavanyo ngaphandle kokutyhalwa.
mt0: <pad> Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."</s>

en: I fear it could end up into fights.
xho: “Ndiyoyika ukuba ingaphelela ekulweni.
mt0: <pad> Ndiyabona ukuba kusenokwenzeka ukuba kubekho iimbambano.</s>

en: You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed.
xho: Uyabona kwenzekile eLiberia mva nje apho abantu ababeze kunceda abantu ekurhaneleka ukuba bosulelwe yi-Ebola bade babulawa.
mt0: <pad> Ubona kwenzeka eLiberia kutshanje apho abantu ababezonceda abantu abanokukrokreleka ukuba bafumene i-Ebola baze babulawe.</s>

en: So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily," said Maulana.
xho: Ngoko ke, imfundo yezoluntu yeyona nto ibalulekileyo ukuze abantu bakhuthazwe ukuba baphume baye kuvavanywa ngokuzithandela,” utshilo uMaulana.
mt0: <pad> Ngoko, ulwazi lwesikolo sibaluleke kakhulu ukuze abantu bakhuthazwe ukuba baphume baze bathathe i-test ngokuzithandela," uthe uMoulana.</s>

en: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
xho: Nangona kunjalo, umcebisi weHIV/AIDS, uDavid Odali, nophethe umbutho i-Umunthu Foundation eqhuba iiprojekthi ezinxulumene ne-HIV, ugxininise ukuba iimfihlo ziza kukhuselwa.
mt0: <pad> Kodwa, i-HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, owase NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.</s>

en: Confidentiality will be upheld. Lets consider the household setup.
xho: Imfihlo iya kugcinwa. Makhe siqwalasele ukusekwa kwekhaya.
mt0: <pad> I-Confidentiality iya kugcinwa. Makhe sijonge indlela yokuseta indlu.</s>

en: I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family.
xho: Ndicinga ukuba into yokuqala iya kuba kukubonelela ngengcebiso yeqela kumalungu olo sapho.
mt0: <pad> Icinga ukuba into yokuqala ekufuneka yenziwe ngukunika uncedo lweqela kubameli baloo khaya.</s>

en: [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.
xho: [Ewe] abantu banokuvavanywa ngelixa abanye bejonge, kodwa xa kuthethwa ngeziphumo, umcebisi kufuneka aveze ezo ziphumo kumntu ngamnye ngokwahlukeneyo,” utshilo u-Odali.
mt0: <pad> [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclose the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.</s>

en: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
xho: UOdali uthe izakuba kuye umntu ovavanyiweyo ukuba aveze ubume bakhe.
mt0: <pad> Odali says it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.</s>

en: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people.
xho: Ngo-2006, i-charity Development Aid from People to People yenza uvavanyo lwe-HIV kwindlu ngendlu kwisithili saseThyolo naseBlantyre, lwafikelela kuma-400,000 abantu.
mt0: <pad> Ngo-2006, i-Development Aid from People to People yenze uqeqesho lwe-HIV kwidolophu yaseTsholo neBlantyre, ufika abantu abane-400,000.</s>

en: The organization says it worked well.
xho: Lo mbutho uthi usebenze kakuhle.
mt0: <pad> The organization says it worked well.</s>

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi.
xho: Ingxaki yamanzi Iphakamisa uloyiko lwezifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi eMalawi.
mt0: <pad> Ixesha lokungcungcutheka kwamanzi eMalawi liphakamisa iingxaki zokugula kwamanzi.</s>

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water.
xho: Abantu baseMalawi abakwikomkhulu lezorhwebo lelizwe, iBlantyre, bakholisa ukuxhomekeka kumanzi aphuma empompeni.
mt0: <pad> Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually depend on tap water.</s>

en: But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.
xho: Kodwa kwezi nyanga zintlanu zidlulileyo, iitepu bezisoloko zomile, nto leyo enyanzelise abahlali ukuba bakhe amanzi kwimithombo engakhuselekanga efana nemilambo namaqula, logama kusetyenzwa kwisikhululo sokumpompa amanzi edolophini.
mt0: <pad> Kodwa kwiinyanga ezidlulileyo, amanzi e-taps amaxesha amaninzi aphelelwa, ngoko abantu kufuneka bathathe amanzi evela kwiindawo ezingakhuselwanga njengemilambo neendonga, ngelixa umsebenzi uqhubeka kwisikhululo sokupompa sase-Mpumalanga.</s>

en: The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
xho: Umngcipheko wokufumana izifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi uyakhula.
mt0: <pad> Risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.</s>

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
xho: EBlantyre neziphaluka, abahlali bachithe iintsuku ezintlanu bengenawo amanzi aphuma etephini.
mt0: <pad> Kwi Blantyre kunye neendawo ezizungezile, abahlali bahlala iintsuku eziyi-5 ngaphandle kwamanzi acacileyo.</s>

en: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
xho: Abasetyhini, abathi ngokwesiko laseMalawi banoxanduva lokwenza imisebenzi yasekhaya, bakhalaza ngeengozi abahlangabezana nazo xa besiya kukha amanzi emilanjeni ekude neendawo zokuhlala.
mt0: <pad> Abantu abafazi, abakudala bajongene nemisebenzi yomsebenzi wesikhaya, bakhalaza ngengozi abajongene nazo xa bekhangela amanzi kwiindawo ezikude ukusuka kwiindawo zokuhlala.</s>

en: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky.
xho: URhoda Milanzi, umama wekhaya kunye nomama wabantwana abathathu, uxelele iVOA ukuba uhambo oluhamba kwiindledlana zeenyawo lunobungozi..
mt0: <pad> Rhoda Milanzi, i-housewife and mother of three, tells VOA that journeys through bushy footpaths are risky.</s>

en: We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water.
xho: “Sivuka yonke imihla ngentsimbi yesi-2 kusasa, ngamanye amaxesha ngo-1 ekuseni, siye kukha amanzi.
mt0: <pad> Siphaphama qho ngo- 2am, ngamanye amaxesha ngo-1am, ukuze siqokelele amanzi.</s>

en: There are so many risks.
xho: Kukho imingcipheko emininzi.
mt0: <pad> Kukho ingozi ezininzi.</s>

en: You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
xho: Uyabona maxa wambi sasidibana namagqwirha, iinyoka endleleni,” utsho, “neengcuka zazisileqa.
mt0: <pad> "See, sometimes we'd meet wizards, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."</s>

en: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river.
xho: UMlanzi uthi ukuthomalalisa umthwalo wokuthwala amanzi okuhlamba ekhaya, abafazi bakhetha ukuhlamba emlanjeni.
mt0: <pad> Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river.</s>

en: But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
xho: Kodwa uthi baye baphazanyiswa lulutsha oluzifihle kumatyholo akufutshane.
mt0: <pad> Kodwa uthe bakhathazwa ngabantwana abafihla kwindawo engakummandla.</s>

en: These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked.
xho: “Olu lutsha lwanamhlanje luza kufika apho luzifihle ndaweni ithile ukuze lusibone sihamba ze.
mt0: <pad> Nangona ezo ntshatsheli zanamhlanje ziza kufika apho, zihlale kwindawo ethile ukuze zibone ukuba sifihlile.</s>

en: This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
xho: Oku kuye kwaba lihlazo elikhulu. Ngenene sakhalaza kwiinkosi ngalo nto.
mt0: <pad> Oku kuye kwaba sisiqalekiso esikhulu. Inyaniso, sikhalazele abaphathi ngako.</s>

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
xho: Abanye babo bohlwaya, kodwa uyazi ukuba ngamanye amaxesha bebekhwela emithini ukuze bajonge abafazi abadala njengathi xa sihlamba,” ucacise watsho.
mt0: <pad> 'Babethelela abanye, kodwa uyakwazi ukuba bamanye amaxesha babekhwela ii-tye ukuze babukele abadala abanjengokuthi sithatha umkhenkce," uthetha.</s>

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
xho: Ingxaki yamanzi ikwachaphazele ukuhanjiswa kweenkonzo zempilo.
mt0: <pad> Ixesha lokusela likwachaphazele iinkonzo zonyango.</s>

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
xho: Kwiiveki ezintathu ezidlulileyo, abasemagunyeni kwisibhedlele iQueen Elizabeth Central eBlantyre baqinisekise ukuba baye banqumamisa ukwenza utyando ngenxa yokunqaba kwamanzi.
mt0: <pad> Kwiiveki ezintathu ezidlulileyo, amagosa eQueen Elizabeth Central Hospital eBlantyre aqinisekisile ukuba bagqibe ukususa iinkqubo zonyango ngenxa yokuntuleka kwamanzi.</s>

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
xho: Abakhankasi bamalungelo ezempilo balumkisa ngokuqhambuka kwezifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi, ngakumbi kwiindawo ezixineneyo, ukuba le meko ishiywe ingasonjululwanga.
mt0: <pad> Campaigners for Health Rights warn of the possibility of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.</s>

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.
xho: Amagosa eBlantyre Water Board abalela ingxaki ikakhulu kwiprojekthi eqhubekayo exhaswa ngemali yi-European Union efuna ukufakela oomatshini bokumpompa abatsha kwi-Walkers Ferry, isikhululo sokumpompa esikhulu.
mt0: <pad> Umsebenzi owenziwa yi European Union ujongene nokufakwa kweemveliso ezintsha kwi-station pumping ekulu, Walkers Ferry.</s>

en: Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
xho: UPriscilla Mateyu, osisithethi sebhodi yamanzi eBlantyre, uthi le projekthi kulindeleke ukuba inyuse umthamo wokuvelisa amanzi ukuya kutsho kwi-105,000 cubic metres ngosuku ukusuka kwimveliso ekhoyo ngoku eyi-78,000 cubic metres ngosuku.
mt0: <pad> Priscilla Mateyu, a spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.</s>

en: January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015].
xho: NgoJanuwari kuxa iprojekthi iphela. Kodwa ukuze oomatshini abatsha nayo yonke enye into iqale ukusebenza kakuhle, kufuneka silinde kude kube nguMatshi [2015].
mt0: <pad> January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015].</s>

en: That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
xho: Kulapho silindele ukuba amanqanaba anyuke kwaye nomthamo wemveliso uphucuke ubeyilento silindele ukuba ibe yiyo,” utshilo uMateyu.
mt0: <pad> "Yaye apho silindele ukuba iipesenti ziya kukhula kwaye amandla okuvelisa aphucuke, ubuncinane into esiyilindele," Mateyu uthe.</s>

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.
xho: Iqumrhu elijongene namalungelo abathengi basekuhlaleni, iConsumers Association of Malawi, bebeceba ukubamba imilindelo kwibhodi yamanzi de kube yinto eqhelekileyo ukuhanjiswa kwamanzi, kodwa ibhodi yacela abaqhankqalazi ukuba bayeke, bethembisa ukuhambisa amanzi kubahlali ngokusebenzisa iitanki zamanzi ezihambayo.
mt0: <pad> The Consumers Association of Malawi, a watchdog for consumer rights, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.</s>

en: The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
xho: Iqela lamalungelo abathengi linike ibhodi yamanzi iiveki ezimbini ukuba ifezekise isibophelelo sayo phambi kokuba iqhube noqhanqalazo.
mt0: <pad> The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.</s>
